title: How to Turn Off SMS on GroupMe on Android

steps.title: Open Chrome.
steps.content: Open Chrome. The GroupMe Android app does not provide a way to disable SMS messages, so you'll need to use a web browser. Chrome is the app with a round red, green, blue, and yellow icon, typically found on the home screen.

steps.title: Tap ⁝.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ . It's at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Request desktop site.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Request desktop site . A check mark will appear in the box beside this option.

steps.title: Type https://www.groupme.com into the address bar and press Enter.
steps.content: Type https://www.groupme.com into the address bar and press Enter . This opens the GroupMe website.

steps.title: Tap Log in.
steps.content: Tap Log in . It's at the top-right corner of the page.

steps.title: Enter your login information and tap Log in.
steps.content: Enter your login information and tap Log in . If your account is connected to your Facebook or Microsoft login, tap one of those options instead.

steps.title: Tap the settings icon.
steps.content: Tap the settings icon. It's the blue gear at the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Slide the “Receive Messages via SMS” switch to the position.
steps.content: Slide the “Receive Messages via SMS” switch to the position. As long as this switch is off, GroupMe will not send you text messages for activity.
